headline: Baker Hughes (BKR) Tops Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
summary: Baker Hughes (BKR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +11.48% and +2.61%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

raw.headline: Baker Hughes (BKR) Tops Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates
raw.summary: Baker Hughes (BKR) delivered earnings and revenue surprises of +11.48% and +2.61%, respectively, for the quarter ended September 2025. Do the numbers hold clues to what lies ahead for the stock?

headline: Baker Hughes: Q3 Earnings Snapshot
summary: HOUSTON (AP) — Baker Hughes Co. (BKR) on Thursday reported third-quarter earnings of $609 million. The Houston-based company said it had profit of 61 cents per share. Earnings, adjusted for non-recurring costs, came to 68 cents per share.

headline: Baker Hughes Company Announces Third-Quarter 2025 Results
summary: Third-quarter highlights Orders of $8.2 billion, including $4.1 billion of IET orders.RPO of $35.3 billion, including record IET RPO of $32.1 billion.Revenue of $7.0 billion, up 1% year-over-year.Attributable net income of $609 million.GAAP diluted EPS of $0.61 and adjusted diluted EPS* of $0.68.Adjusted EBITDA* of $1,238 million, up 2% year-over-year.Cash flows from operating activities of $929 million and free cash flow* of $699 million. headline: Baker Hughes Declares Quarterly Dividend
summary: HOUSTON and LONDON, Oct. 23, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Baker Hughes (NASDAQ: BKR) announced today that the Baker Hughes Board of Directors declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.23 per share of Class A common stock payable on Nov. 14, 2025, to holders of record on Nov. 4, 2025. Baker Hughes expects to fund its quarterly cash dividend from cash generated from operations. About Baker Hughes:Baker Hughes (NASDAQ: BKR) is an energy technology company that provides solutions to energy and industrial

headline: Will Baker Hughes' (BKR) Leadership Shuffle Reinforce Its Long-Term Growth Ambitions?
summary: On October 7, 2025, Baker Hughes announced that Ganesh Ramaswamy resigned as Executive Vice President, Industrial & Energy Technology, with Maria Claudia Borras stepping in on an interim basis while also serving as Chief Growth and Experience Officer. Borras’s three decades of experience at Baker Hughes and her dual leadership role highlight the company’s focus on enterprise growth and adapting to ongoing industry changes. We'll explore how this executive transition and the upcoming earnings...

headline: AI’s insatiable need for power is driving an unexpected boom in oil-fracking company stocks
summary: The CEO of the U.S. energy secretary’s fracking company said Trump’s tariffs are getting in the way of U.S. energy and AI dominance.
